{{good article}} {{Infobox road |state=MI |type=CDH |route=H-63 |map=Michigan H-63 map.png |map_notes=H-63 highlighted in red |alternate_name=Mackinac Trail |maint={{abbr|MCRC|Mackinac County Road Commission}} and {{abbr|CCRC|Chippewa County Road Commission}} |length_mi=45.38 |length_round=2 |length_ref= |established={{circa|October 5, 1970}} |direction_a=South |terminus_a={{jct|state=MI|I|75|BL|75|dab2=St. Ignace}} near [[St. Ignace, Michigan|St. Ignace]] |junction={{jct|state=MI|M|123|to1=TO}} near [[St. Ignace, Michigan|St. Ignace]]
{{jct|state=MI|M|134|to1=TO}} near [[St. Ignace, Michigan|St. Ignace]]
{{jct|state=MI|M|48}} near [[Rudyard, Michigan|Rudyard]]
{{jct|state=MI|I|75|M|80}} in [[Kinross, Michigan|Kinross]]
{{jct|state=MI|M|28}} near [[Dafter, Michigan|Dafter]] |direction_b=North |terminus_b={{jct|state=MI|BS|75|dab1=Sault Ste. Marie}} in [[Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan|Sault Ste. Marie]] |counties=[[Mackinac County, Michigan|Mackinac]], [[Chippewa County, Michigan|Chippewa]] |previous_type=CDH |previous_route=H-60 |next_type=CDH |next_route=A-2 }} '''H-63''' is a [[List of County-Designated Highways in Michigan|county-designated highway]] (CDH) in the [[Upper Peninsula of Michigan|Upper Peninsula]] of the US state of [[Michigan]]. The highway parallels the [[Interstate 75 in Michigan|Interstate 75]] (I-75) corridor between [[St. Ignace, Michigan|St. Ignace]] and [[Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan|Sault Ste. Marie]]. The road is called [[Mackinac Trail]] after the Upper Peninsula branch of an Indian trail used before European settlers reached the area. Originally, the roadway was built as a section of [[U.S. Route 2 in Michigan|US Highway 2]] (US 2) before being added to the CDH system in the 1970s. H-63 serves as a two-lane alternative to the I-75 freeway across the eastern end of the Upper Peninsula. Between the northern side of St. Ignace, the roadway has connections to two state highways before [[concurrency (road)|running concurrently]] with [[M-48 (Michigan highway)|M-48]] near [[Rudyard, Michigan|Rudyard]]. H-63 ends on the south side of Sault Ste. Marie. ==Route description== H-63 starts a winding trail at [[Interstate 75 Business (St. Ignace, Michigan)|Business Loop I-75]] (BL I-75) north of St. Ignace in rural [[Mackinac County, Michigan|Mackinac County]]. From there, the highway heads northward towards the Kewadin Casino. The road then passes within viewing distance of I-75 past the [[Horseshoe Bay Wilderness]]. As it continues, H-63 has a connection to the southern terminus of [[M-123 (Michigan highway)|M-123]] with access to I-75 via a connecting road to M-123. After crossing to the west side of I-75, H-63 has access to I-75 via a connecting road to the western terminus of [[M-134 (Michigan highway)|M-134]]. The CDH runs to the north and into [[Chippewa County, Michigan|Chippewa County]]. As it does so, H-63 turns away from I-75 as the latter curves northeastward. South of [[Rudyard, Michigan|Rudyard]] and into center of the community, H-63 [[concurrency (road)|runs concurrently]] with [[M-48 (Michigan highway)|M-48]] for about {{convert|3|mi|km|spell=in}}. From Rudyard northward, H-63 turns northeasterly toward, and runs parallel to, I-75. At [[Kinross, Michigan|Kinross]], there is an interchange between I-75 and [[M-80 (Michigan highway)|M-80]]; H-63 has a brief concurrency with M-80 so that the latter can connect to all of the ramps in the interchange. The trail then crosses to the eastern side of I-75. Near [[Dafter, Michigan|Dafter]], the CDH intersects [[M-28 (Michigan highway)|M-28]]. Along this section, H-63 is roughly a half mile (0.8 km) away from the I-75 freeway at any given point as it continues northward to the Sault Ste. Marie area. H-63 terminates at its intersection with [[Interstate 75 Business (Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan)|Business Spur I-75]] (BS I-75) on the south side of the city.{{cite MDOT map |year=2010 |sections=B11–D10}}{{google maps |url=https://maps.google.com/maps?f=d&source=s_d&saddr=Unknown+road&daddr=45.926172,-84.7362829+to:45.9904371,-84.7342472+to:46.17034,-84.60745+to:46.24465,-84.57186+to:46.3055323,-84.4727995+to:46.3996631,-84.3956764+to:W+3+Mile+Rd&hl=en&geocode=FT57vAIduPry-g%3BFRzHvAId5gbz-ilfSfzx7fc1TTEshE1JlecOtQ%3BFSXCvQId2Q7z-imtXZzfmPg1TTH6Gxcum7-wnQ%3BFeSAwAIdJv70-iljDnuwGgQ2TTEyeY63LMrbGg%3BFSqjwQIdLIn1-inzRY4sNBs2TTFquss6SIaW5w%3BFfyQwgIdIQz3-ilFXyxWzRA2TTH4e6_C98SlSQ%3BFa8AxAIdZDn4-ikPjf4pCz42TTHpcp0A4FOebA%3BFYD5xAId_pD4-g&mra=dpe&mrcr=0&mrsp=6&sz=13&via=1,2,3,4,5,6&sll=46.427919,-84.38942&sspn=0.111813,0.128231&ie=UTF8&ll=46.26819,-84.48761&spn=0.897113,1.025848&t=h&z=10 |title=Overview Map of H-63 |accessdate=September 21, 2010}} ==History== The first transportation route in the area was the Mackinac Trail, used by Native Americans before the Europeans arrived in the area; the trail in the area was the Upper Peninsula branch of a longer route that also connected the modern-day [[Saginaw, Michigan|Saginaw]] with [[Mackinaw City, Michigan|Mackinaw City]] and the [[Straits of Mackinac]].{{cite book |last=Mason |first=Philip P. |year=1959 |title=Michigan Highways from Indian Trails to Expressways |location=Ann Arbor, MI |publisher=Braun-Brumfield |page=18 |oclc=23314983}} Until 1933, no roadway was built along the path of the Indian trail. After that year, US 2 was rerouted between St. Ignace and Sault Ste. Marie using the modern routing of H-63.{{cite MDOT map |date=1933-05-01 |c-link= yes |sections=B11–D10}}{{cite MDOT map |date=1933-09-01 |sections=B11–D10}} This placed the Mackinac Trail on the [[Michigan State Trunkline Highway System|state trunkline highway system]] for the first time. In 1962 and 1963, the state transferred the highway to county control when US 2 was rerouted to follow the completed I-75 freeway.{{cite MDOT map |year= 1962 |sections=B11–D10}}{{cite MDOT map |year=1963 |sections=B11–D10}}{{cite MDOT map |year=1964 |sections=B11–D10}} With the transfer to local control, Mackinac Trail became a county road. Later, it was given the H-63 designation after October 5, 1970 as part of the County-Designated Highway System.{{cite news |title= County Primary Road Marking System Okayed |work=[[Holland Sentinel|Holland Evening Sentinel]] |date=October 5, 1970 |page=6 |issn= 1050-4044 |oclc= 49995441}} The designation on the 1971 state map follows the routing used today.{{cite MDOT map |year=1971 |sections=E10–E11}} ==Major intersections== {{MIinttop|ref={{cite web |author= Michigan Center for Geographic Information |title= Geographic Data Library |date= May 2007 |publisher= [[Michigan Department of Information Technology]] |url= http://www.mcgi.state.mi.us/mgdl/?rel=thext&action=thmname&cid=14&cat=MI+Geographic+Framework+All+Roads+%28v7b%29 |accessdate=February 4, 2008 }}}} {{MIint |county=Mackinac |cspan=3 |location=St. Ignace Township |lspan=3 |mile=0.00 |road={{jct|state=MI|I|75|city1=St. Ignace|city2=Sault Ste. Marie}}
{{jct|state=MI|BL|75|dab1=St. Ignace|city1=St. Ignace|dir1=south}}
{{jct|state=MI|Tour|LHCT}} |notes= }} {{MIint |mile=4.67 |road={{jct|state=MI|M|123|to1=To|city1=Trout Lake|dir1=north}} |notes= }} {{MIint |mile=12.00 |road={{jct|state=MI|M|134|Tour|LHCT|to1=To|city1=Cedarville|dir1=east|dir2=east}} |notes= }} {{MIint |county=Chippewa |cspan=6 |location=Rudyard Township |type=concur |mile=22.26 |road={{jct|state=MI|M|48|dir1=east|city1=Pickford}} |notes=Southern end of M-48 concurrency}} {{MIint |location=Rudyard |lspan=2 |type=concur |mile=25.17 |road={{jct|state=MI|M|48||dir1=west}} |notes=Northern end of M-48 concurrency; access to [[Interstate 75 in Michigan|I-75]]}} {{MIint |mile=25.31 |road={{jct|state=MI|CDH|H-40|county1=Chippewa|dir1=west}} |notes=Eastern terminus of H-40}} {{MIint |location=Kinross |mile=30.49 |mile2=30.78 |type=concur |road={{jct|state=MI|I|75|M|80|dir2=east|city1=St. Ignace|city2=Sault Ste. Marie}} |notes=Short concurrency at the western terminus of M-80 so the latter can connect to all of the ramps in the I-75 exit 378 interchange}} {{MIint |location=Dafter Township |mile=39.02 |road={{jct|state=MI|M|28|city1=Munising|city2=Marquette}}|notes=}} {{MIint |location=Sault Ste. Marie |mile=45.38 |road={{jct|state=MI|BS|75|Tour|LHCT|dab1=Sault Ste. Marie|city1=Sault Ste. Marie}} |notes= }} {{jctbtm|keys=concur}} ==See also== *{{portal-inline|Michigan Highways}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Attached KML|display=inline,title}} *[http://www.michiganhighways.org/listings/MichHwysH16-H63.html#H-63 H-63 at Michigan Highways] {{DEFAULTSORT:H63}} [[Category:County-designated highways in Michigan]] [[Category:Transportation in Mackinac County, Michigan]] [[Category:Transportation in Chippewa County, Michigan]] [[Category:U.S. Route 2]]
